title: Ordering Coffee at a Local Cafe

setting.context: You are at a busy neighborhood cafe in the morning. You want to order a drink and a small snack before starting your day.
setting.your_role: A customer looking for a caffeine fix

your_options.text: Hello! Could I have a medium latte, please?
Hi! Can I get a small americano, please?
With oat milk, please. No sugar.
I don't like milk. Just black.
To go, please. And I'll take that blueberry muffin too.
I'll drink it here. No food.
For here, please. Actually, do you have any croissants left?

key_vocabulary.word: Could I have / Can I get

cultural_notes: In many English-speaking countries, it is common to say 'How are you?' as a greeting, but you don't need to give a long answer.
Tipping at coffee shops is often optional but appreciated, usually done by rounding up the change or adding a small amount to the card payment.
Specifying 'to go' or 'for here' is essential as it determines if you get a paper cup or a ceramic mug.
